dfischer.utils

Interface VaryingLoadInterface


  • public interface VaryingLoadInterface
    Supports to increment or to decrement the number of simulated users at runtime.
    Since:
    Proxy Sniffer V5.2-O

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearIncrementUser()
      Set that the simulated user is no longer pending to be incremented.
      long getIncrementUserStartTime()
      Get for an incremented user the absolute time when the first loop must be started.
      int incrementUsers(int numAddUsers, long startupDelay)
      Advise the load test program to increment the number of simulated users.
      boolean isDecrementEndOfLoopFlag()
      Get if a simulated user is instructed to stop load test execution.
      boolean isIncrementUser()
      Get if the simulated user is pending to be incremented.
      void setDecrementEndOfLoopFlag(boolean decrementEndOfLoopFlag)
      Set a flag to instruct a simulated user to stop load test execution.
      void setIncrementUser(long startTime)
      Set for an incremented user the absolute time when the first loop must be started.
      void setIncrementUserStartTime(long startTime)
      Set for an incremented user a new absolute time when the first loop must be started.

    • Method Detail

      • setDecrementEndOfLoopFlag

        void setDecrementEndOfLoopFlag(boolean decrementEndOfLoopFlag)
        Set a flag to instruct a simulated user to stop load test execution.
        Parameters:
        decrementEndOfLoopFlag - true = the simulated user is instructed to stop load test execution after the current loop is completed

      • isDecrementEndOfLoopFlag

        boolean isDecrementEndOfLoopFlag()
        Get if a simulated user is instructed to stop load test execution.
        Returns:
        true = the simulated user is instructed to stop load test execution after the current loop is completed

      • incrementUsers

        int incrementUsers(int numAddUsers,
                 long startupDelay)
        Advise the load test program to increment the number of simulated users.
        Parameters:
        numAddUsers - the number of simulated users to increment
        startupDelay - the startup delay per user in milliseconds, -1 = use default startup delay as passed to the load test job
        Returns:
        the accepted number of planned users to increment. This value is normally equal to numAddUsers. but can be smaller or zero if the operation or part of the operation can't be performed.

      • setIncrementUser

        void setIncrementUser(long startTime)
        Set for an incremented user the absolute time when the first loop must be started.
        Parameters:
        startTime - the absolute time when the first loop must be started (elapsed milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT). If this time is in the past the incremented user starts the work instantly.

      • isIncrementUser

        boolean isIncrementUser()
        Get if the simulated user is pending to be incremented.
        Returns:
        true = the simulated user is pending to be incremented

      • clearIncrementUser

        void clearIncrementUser()
        Set that the simulated user is no longer pending to be incremented.

      • getIncrementUserStartTime

        long getIncrementUserStartTime()
        Get for an incremented user the absolute time when the first loop must be started.
        Returns:
        the absolute time when the first loop must be started (elapsed milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT). If this time is in the past the incremented user starts the work instantly.

      • setIncrementUserStartTime

        void setIncrementUserStartTime(long startTime)
        Set for an incremented user a new absolute time when the first loop must be started. This method is only called if a suspend and resume occurs during incrementing the user.
        Parameters:
        startTime - the absolute time when the first loop must be started (elapsed milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT). If this time is in the past the incremented user starts the work instantly.
